identity.name: Numis - The Curator's Vault
identity.vibe: Museum Archive meets Swiss Finance. Precision, History, Value.
principles: The Coin is the Hero: Interface recedes, content shines.
Tactile Digital: Use noise, shadows, and motion to mimic physical collecting.
Data as Art: Stats are not just numbers, they are the collection's pulse.
Asymmetry: Break the grid to create visual interest.

heading.usage: Hero titles, Section headers, Big stats. Use font-weight 700 or 800 for impact.

rules: Numbers: Use tabular-nums for prices and years.

visual_enhancers.texture: url("data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg viewBox='0 0 200 200' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%3E%3Cfilter id='noiseFilter'%3E%3CfeTurbulence type='fractalNoise' baseFrequency='0.65' numOctaves='3' stitchTiles='stitch'/%3E%3C/filter%3E%3Crect width='100%25' height='100%25' filter='url(%23noiseFilter)' opacity='0.05'/%3E%3C/svg%3E")

layout_strategy.spacing: Generous. Use py-12 or py-24 for section gaps.

CoinCard.description: A minimalist card that focuses on the circular coin image.
structure: Image: Aspect ratio 1:1, rounded-full, shadow-lg group-hover:shadow-xl transition-all
Meta: flex row gap-2 text-sm text-muted-foreground

FilterBar.description: Floating pill-shaped bar at the bottom or top, not a sidebar.
FilterBar.style: fixed bottom-8 left-1/2 -translate-x-1/2 z-50 bg-background/80 backdrop-blur-md border border-border rounded-full px-6 py-3 shadow-2xl flex gap-4 items-center

StatsWidget.content: Label (uppercase, small) + Value (huge, font-heading) + Trend (small, colored)

instructions_to_main_agent: 1. INSTALL FONTS: Add Syne and Manrope from Google Fonts to index.html or import in CSS.
2. SETUP TAILWIND: Extend the theme with the colors and fonts defined above.
3. CREATE LAYOUT: Build a 'DashboardLayout' and 'PublicLayout'. Dashboard should use a sidebar, Public should use a top nav.
4. BUILD COMPONENTS: Start with the 'CoinCard' and 'FilterBar'. Use Shadcn for the internal logic but style them according to the 'Visual Enhancers'.
5. USE IMAGES: Use the provided Unsplash URLs for the landing page and empty states.
6. DATA MOCKING: Create a robust mock data file for coins if the backend isn't ready. The UI must look populated.
7. DARK MODE: Implement a theme toggle. Default to 'System'.
8. MAP: For the 'Map' view, use a simple CSS grid of country codes or a static SVG if a library is too heavy. Do not overengineer the map initially.
UNIVERSAL_GUIDELINES_FOR_MAIN_AGENT: Avoid generic 'AI slop' designs. Be bold with spacing.
Make sure the '2 Euro' identity is clear - use the gold/silver color scheme subtly.
